page.title: 12The Railway
page.content: The railway line from Aberystwyth to Shrewsbury goes through Halfway House.Although it passes right through our squares we have no direct way of getting on the trains so we have to go to Shrewsbury or Welshpool to get on.The line was started in 1861 and finished in 1929.Westbury station closed on the 12 September 1960.The line is named the Cambrian line and was owned by the Cambrian Railway Company and the headquarters was at Oswestry. It was then taken over by the Great Western Railway and now it's British Rail.There was talk of closing the line.Now they have decided to improve it.Next year fast trains are to be introduced.The line has five crossings. One is automatic and the rest are bridges except one at map bearing 098333.
